intro: Symblomeria baldwiniana, commonly known as the Baldwin's symblomeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
